comments:
[using 3.2 RC1 on RedHat Enterprise Linux 64bit]

During install of various projects from the Callisto discovery update site, I got the following exception near to the end:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/update/internal/core/PatchedFeature
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.ConfigurationPolicy.buildPatchedFeatures(ConfigurationPolicy.java:348)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.ConfigurationPolicy.getPluginPath(ConfigurationPolicy.java:304)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InstallConfiguration.savePluginPath(InstallConfiguration.java:448)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InstallConfiguration.save(InstallConfiguration.java:396)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.LocalSite.save(LocalSite.java:190)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.operations.BatchInstallOperation.execute(BatchInstallOperation.java:103)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2.install(InstallWizard2.java:374)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2.access$1(InstallWizard2.java:371)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2$1.run(InstallWizard2.java:472)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
This class exists in update. It seems like a problem outside of update.
DJ: this looks like a runtime problem, can you please comment.
Do you have the full log?
Unfortunately the complete log got lost, sorry!
